extendedIngredients.name: arugula
extendedIngredients.original: 2 bunches arugula (about 10 ozs total), stems trimmed

extendedIngredients.name: goat cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 5 ozs fresh goat cheese, room temperature

extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large red onion, sliced 1/2 inch thick

extendedIngredients.name: rib-eye steaks
extendedIngredients.original: 3 boneless rib-eye steaks (each about 1 lb and 1 inch thick), excess fat removed

title: Grilled Steak Sandwiches With Goat Cheese And Arugula
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Grilled Steak Sandwiches With Goat Cheese And Arugulan a try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 27g of protein, 32g of fat, and a total of 531 calories. For $3.65 per serving, this recipe covers 21% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. 12 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 25 minutes. A mixture of arugula, goat cheese, rib-eye steaks, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the coarse salt you could follow this main course with the Healthy Raw Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 75%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Grilled Goat Cheese & Arugula Sandwiches, Warm Goat Cheese, Beet and Arugula Sandwiches, and Grilled Apricot, Arugulan and Goat Cheese Salad.

winePairing.pairingText: Steak on the menu? Try pairing with Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Pinot Noir. After all, beef and red wine are a classic combination. Generally, leaner steaks go well with light or medium-bodied reds, such as pinot noir or merlot, while fattier steaks can handle a bold red, such as cabernet sauvingnon. One wine you could try is Flora Springs Napa Valley Merlot. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.

productMatches.title: Flora Springs Napa Valley Merlot
productMatches.description:
Bursting with big black cherry, juniper berry and black licorice flavors, easing into notes of cardamom, cinnamon, and gentle vanilla creme. There's an intriguing granite minerality to the wine along with a toasty, sweet oak profile in the finish. This is a wonderful stand-alone wine, but can be paired with a variety of dishes. 
It's forceful personality make it a good match for almost anything a Cabernet would be paired with, a favorite steak dish for instance, yet the wine's tannin structure is soft enough to pair with eggplant parmesan or your favorite chicken dish.

instructions: Meanwhile, grill onion until tender and charred, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate; separate into rings. (To store, refrigerate steaks and onion, up to 1 day.)

steps.step: Meanwhile, grill onion until tender and charred, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate; separate into rings. (To store, refrigerate steaks and onion, up to 1 day.)
